abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            "unsatisfactory". Major components were not
            completed and the sustainability of project results is
            uncertain, notwithstanding the successful rehabilitation of
            generation facilities, including costs and outages
            reduction. The Bank's performance for project
            identification/preparation is rated
            "satisfactory"; however, for appraisal/supervision
            it is rated "unsatisfactory". Even though the Bank
            responded expeditiously to an emergency, it did not
            incorporate safeguards into project design in the form of a
            commitment by the Borrower to implement the tariff related
            recommendations. Equally, the Borrower is rated positively
            for preparation/implementation, but negatively on the issue
            of tariff related and environmental components, as well as
            compliance with reporting requirements. The key lessons
            learned are: 1) at project preparation: project objectives
            should reflect a clear priority ranking and Borrower
            commitment should be ensured prior to loan approval.
            Further, project design should support project objectives,
            with special care towards enforceable components and
            covenants; 2) During project implementation: regular
            supervision and mid-term reviews are essential; under
            non-compliance situations with loan/project covenants, the
            Bank should exercise remedies, including suspension/cancellation.
